category: foot or leg injury, general injury, hand or arm injury, slips & trips
text: ip tripped whilst walking to kitchen. migrated from legacy cairs incident #34439whilst walking to kitchen, ip lost balance and fell, landing on the floor.ip was also carrying cup at time however this was empty. ip sustained no visible injuries and did not seek assessment from first aider as felt was not required. ip later stated that she had sore arm/shoulder and leg as a result of the fall. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

category: head or face injury, lifting or moving loads, general injury, general illness or health issue
text: while connecting torque tubes as part of a team, tube fell and bounced, making contact with worker's hard hat/head a subcontractor employee was working as part of a three man team, (himself, another laborer,forklift operator) connecting torque tubes together. the process is completed by loading the forks with single stack of 10torque tubes onto the forks of a rough terrain forklift. this leaves approximately 4" of fork left between the 10th torquetube, and fork tip. the tubes are held level at a height that allows for one worker to maneuver the tube into place at eachend of the tube. the employee in front pulls by setting the tube in his shoulder, (supported by the forks) and pulls thetube, guides and pulls the tube, while a second pushes. in this case, as the employees began to move the tube, sliding it ina horizontal direction, the tube slid toward and off the edge of the forks falling to the ground. once the back half fell fromthe rear employee's grip, it hit the ground, and the portion of the tube on the employee's shoulder bounced and contactedthe employee on the hard hat/head.the worker was taken offsite to a clinic where he was diagnosed with a mild concussion and directed to treat the symptoms with otc medication.  at follow-up on 7/20/16, the worker was diagnosed with a neck strain and prescribed prescription strength anti-inflammatory medication and work restrictions until next follow-up.  worker taken to offsite clinic and diagnosed with a mild concussion.  at follow-up, worker was diagnosed with a neck strain
confirmed positive for covid-19 employee received positive test results for covid-19. contact tracing underway.  employee working from home during quarantine period.

attended meeting where client rep was found to be case+ ip confirmed case+ today. attended meeting where client rep was found to be case+ ip confirmed case+ today. ip isolated. all personnel currently being tested.

during pre-use inspection of a high pressure hose it was identified fitting had detached. migrated from legacy cairs incident #33877note following investigation findingsthere is evidence to support that the hose has potentially been on the nrc since hook up (approx. 4 years),considering other hoses from the same location in the cer meeting to discuss with wg & wel as action notes.incident report:upon pre-inspection of a high pressure hose (as part of a hired pump and guage kit) it was identified that a fitting had detached.investigation ongoinga high pressure hose as part of a pump & gauge kit was found to have a fitting detached. this issue was identified as part of a pre-use inspection by a wood group commissioning team member the kit is 'temporary equipment' and has undergone t4 inspectionit is evident that the fitting ferrule has not been crimped as the connection at the alternate end is bulbous (refer to photo attachments labelled "fittings").equipment details:- high pressure hose (prochem 316 braid) as part of pump & gauge kit (crystal 10000psi pressure calibrator)- pump & gauge id no: eq002251; s/n: 067699- delivery no: 70562227t4 inspection details:- sap notification no. t4: 94010296- date inspected: 10/02/17- supplier: precise facilities- inspector: angel kovokesti (name tbc - ineligible on t4 tag)investigation findings-k christie wg hse - 20th may 2017wg were initially advised of a reported incident involving a prochem 316 high pressure hose found to have a fitting detached. initially wg were made aware that although the hose had not been used it had possibly been on the platform since 18th february 2017 as part of a hired pressure calibrator kit which had been t4 inspected (certificate of conformity) as attached to kit -sap noti - 94010296. due to difficulties contacting the supply chain / project management team from offshore , wg hse onshore (perth) were in the process of contacting the team and liaising with precise facilities (supplier of crystal 100000psi pressure calibrator kit -id no: eq002251, s/n 067699. (prochem 316 braid) to provide the information , quality checks on the equipment accordingly.k christie wg hse - 22nd may 2017 -attachment a1(e-mail)wg hse received details of the t4 - sap no 94010296 equipment and collection from precise facilities report from february 16th 2017, attached is a copy of the shipping details for the order supplied to be sent for inspection. copy of the t4 temporary equipment request (t4) and certificate of conformity supplied and attached to report .k christie wg hse - 23rd may 2017 -attachment a2(e-mail)wg hse contacted jenna haerewa logistics lead (precise facilities) - to supply the appropriate quality checks / certification for the high pressure hose that was identified as being supplied by precise facilities as part of the sap no 94010296 kit in february 2017.jenna haerewa sent a reply back identifying that the damaged high pressure hose in question was not part of the kit supplied in february 2017, jenna also sent through the completed t4 inspection report which was signed off by the inspector angel kovaceski on the 13th february 2017. attached along with the t4 report was a copy of the calibration certificate (certificate no:2105004166) - that covered the certification of the pressure calibrator 10000psi kit, eq002251, s/n:067699.signed off and calibrated by james prindiville (09.02.17).k christie wg hse - 24th may 2017 -attachment a3(e-mail)wg hse contacted prasanna sakthisekaran wg snr contracts specialist to contact pressure dynamics and confirm if the high pressure hose was supplied by them to the project. confirmation received from gerry fratel snr engineer and technical advisor on the 25th may 2017, that the hose was not supplied by pressure dynamics and advised to contact prochem direct to assist in tracing the supplier.k christie wg hse - 25th may 2017 -attachment a4(e-mail)wg hse contacted ian mullin wg snr purchasing officer to contact prochem diect to identify the origin /supplier of the subject hose, recognising that although it is tagged "prochecm 316 braid", it may have been sourced from prochem by others. prochem were asked to advise if they could identify who these were supplied to and when?alex follington sales manager of prochem replied on the 25th may 2017 to identify that although the hose certainly looked like one of their hoses, it was noted that the tagging system had not been used for years and certainly not consistent with sully to woodside projects. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

high level alarm activated at the entrance to the ammonia building. migrated from legacy cairs incident #32314high level alarm was activated at the entrance of the ammonia building indicating high levels of ammonia gas within the air space. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

during scs deployment a roblon rope broke during deployment of the scs a roblon rope, which forms part of the protection system got caught in a block and failed, resulting in a section of rope coming to ground works ceased

category: fall from or working at height issue, slips & trips
text: scaffold tube (transom) fell from a scaffold during the dismantle process. migrated from legacy cairs incident #33994during the dismantle of a scaffold located under the catwalks on port side hms queen elizabeth, a transom has fallen onto the barge/pontoon below. the transom was not dropped.no injured parties. investigation has begun and ongoing, more details added when established.hanging scaffold erected by cape, location under the catwalks/ port side 13/02/17 dismantle of the port side hanging scaffold proceeded approx. 19/05/17 dismantle was on an ad-hoc basis, only when the titan mewp became available on the pontoon.a verbal request was made from the client to wgis scaffold supervisor barry wrighton theevening of 06/06/17 from ship manager (alan adamson bae) to proceed with the dismantle of a few droppers and transoms that were left fixed to the underside of the catwalk..on the morning of 07/06/17 barry wrightcontacted scaffolder neil toogood by telephone and asked him to meet alan adamson to discuss the dismantle process. barry wright (supervisor) started his annual leave on the morning of 07/06/17, with supervisor kevin dobson taking charge of barry's squad.started shift at 7.30 am, request from supervisor to meet on the dockside09.00, to await the transfer boat out to the pontoon to commence with the dismantle of the remaining droppers and transoms left fixed to the underside of the catwalk. 2 scaffolders requested were paul dodkins and neil toogood. pd and nt met supervisor kevin dobson on the dockside. powsa was completed on the dockside and signed by the supervisor before the 2 scaffs were transferred over to begin work from the pontoon. no wgis supervision was present on the pontoon. report of a dropped tube to the hse dept 12.00a verbal request was made to wgis supervision to commence with the dismantle of the few remaining droppers and transoms from underside of the catwalk hms queen elizabeth. as previously stated, this scaffold dismantle was being carried out on an ad-hoc basis, dependant on the mewp availability.the work activity on the day was verbally requested by the client to wgis scaffold and had not been scheduled or programmed using the sssl works control system.two wgis scaffolders pd and nt (cisrs registered, none advanced) were transferred over to the pontoon b y boat to begin with the dismantle, the duration was to be 2/3 hours. the pontoon was under the control of babcock harbour master john pate and the mewp was also provided by babcock. also on the pontoon were operatives from star international who were using the mewp to carry out checks on the emergency evacuation systems. star international also provided the mewp operator. normal procedure when the mewp is in use, would be any ops located on the pontoon to be vacated to the steel welfare cabin until the mewp became available for the specific trades. john pate has confirmed that at the time of the incident, there were approx. 10 operatives located on the pontoon. the dismantle process began when the mewp boomwas manoeuvred into position by the operator just outside of a dropper. a ledger was removed, which left one transom between front and rear dropper, one end of the transom was loosened and the end of the transom was rested (approx. 6 inches) on the edge of the mewp basket. the other end was considered as secure in its double right angled coupler. as the scaffolder proceeded to remove the top fitting from the dropper, it was at this moment that the transom slipped out of its coupler at the far end and fell to the pontoon below. (approx. 20 mtrs) both scaffolders looked below and saw the transom lying on the deck. both scaffs state that they never touched the far end coupler and that it must have been loose. they also claim to haveidentified a few loose fittings during the dismantle process. due to the size of the pontoon (20mtrs by 10 mtrs approx.)when the titan is in operation, the whole of the pontoon is deemed as a safe zone, with all ops with the exception of the banksman (who on this occasion was the barge master jp) returning to the steel container (welfare facilities). however on this occasion jp states that there were 5 ops on the pontoon out of the welfare unit at the time of the dropped tube. it is to be noted that the 5 ops were not in the area where the tube landed, however jp (banksman) states that the tube landed a few feet (approx. 5ft) away from where he was standing. jp stated that the tube deflected off the mewp (leaving a dent) before falling to the deck. jp was the only individual in the close proximity of the scaffold migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

ip reported to 1st aider that he had got a splinter in finger on left hand middle finger whilst placing hand on door frame. ip was displaying a "caution, wet floor" safety notice when he placed his hand on the door frame and a splinter (appx 10mm in length) entered his middle finger on the left hand at about the upper joint. wound cleaned with wipe.  advised ip by first aider they could not attempt to remove the splinter as initially no tweezers available.  ip attempted to remove splinter himself but was unable to do so.called ip's doctor - advised that they did not deal with this but to go to minor injuries unit.advised ip to attend minor injuries unit.  ip did not do so.  reiterated the gps advice to go to minor injuries unit.  suggested that even if ip did get splinter out himself later that he kept a look out for infection. gave plaster to ip.  ip returned to work.

an employee was driving his personal vehicle when he contacted the back of another vehicle at a stop sign because the heel of his boot hit the accelerator rather than the brake. migrated from legacy cairs incident #34603on monday, september 18, 2017 at 5:00pm at hunstman an infinity construction employee was driving his personal vehicle when he contacted the back of another vehicle at a stop sign because the heel of his boot hit the accelerator rather than the brake. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

category: foot or leg injury, lifting or moving loads, vehicle incident general
text: banks-man was walking with forklift driver, trapped foot between tyre of forklift and kerb, resulting in bruising to right foot. migrated from legacy cairs incident #30111what:banks-man (informal terminology - not formally trained)was supporting a forklift driver withthe transportation of individual "i" beam sections of varying lengths from one location to another. the lengths of the beams varied on each journey. the section sizes were (310mm x 125mm), the length of the beam at the time of the incident was 2485mm. the distance travelled for the journey was approx. 125mtrs or 410ft.where:the incident occurred outside of the buildingat psj - bedford.when:the incident occurred at 16:20pm on wednesday 30th march 2016.why:a full investigation will be conducted. the flt was avoiding a parked car outside the psj building and the driver was looking that the load would not impact the parked car. at the same time, the banksman on the other side of the flt to the car, was trying to help and attempted to manually manipulate the load so it would not struck the car. at this pointit seems that the banks-man may have lost balance between the roadway and kerb,he had to quickly adjust his footing as not to loose balance, as a consequence his foot became trapped between the kerb and the tyre of the forklift truck.outcome:bruising to right foot. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

wood employees hit head against pipe support  while on his site workaround/survey wood employee slightly hit his forehead against the pipe support shown in the attached photo. as a result, a little scratch occurred on his face ( just above the right eyebrow). the ip visited the site medic who applied the alcohol-based liquid to irrigate the scratch.  the ip reported to platform hse lead and visited site medic

elkhorn employee was cleaning the bed of a pick-up and made contact with a shovel and the corner of the rear window. as employee was driving to the next work location the window completely shattered. migrated from legacy cairs incident #32154this morning at around 10:00 a.m. while working at the fab area at south park. an elkhorn employee started cleaning up the bed of our pickup truck because he needed to go to plant 3 and get some material for the fabrication they were working on. while moving some shovels around, he hit the bottom left corner of the rear window, but he only noticed a small crack. on his way to plant three with all the bumps on the road it shattered completely, then he came back to the fab area and reported it to hissupervisor. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

tip of the index finger crushed while relocating a safety equipment cabinet. ip was part of a work group relocating a safety equipment cabinet using a pallet jack. the ip sustained a crush injury to the tip of his left index finger. ip is being demobilised from the platform for further medical assessment. job stopped and ip attended medic for assessment.

operator backed into another contractors van with a skid steer. migrated from legacy cairs incident #38079on 5/23/18 at approx. 9:15 am an operator was tasked with placing topsoil in a newly constructed concrete island at project waterford. while placing this soil a van parked in the parking spot next to the island being worked in. operator seen the van and was slowly reversing and miss judged the distance to van and contacted the front left of the van. very minimal damage was caused. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

homeworking ip contracted covid-19 homeworking ip became unwell and subsequently tested positive for coronavirus ip contacted her line manager to confirm result. line manager will keep in touch with her to monitor her recovery.

category: eye injury or irritation, slips & trips
text: client closed breaker and tripped circuit.  client closed breaker a second time, and an arc flash occurred client personnel engaged the mcc disconnect and the breaker tripped.  instead of checking the data to see what caused the trip, the client personnel closed the breaker again, causing an arc-flash.   all arc-flash boundaries were in place.  upon inspection, electrical workers discovered a cross-phased cable as the cause. all equipment lockout and tested to identify cause of incident.

category: foot or leg injury, slips & trips
text: ip tripped and hit his right knee against the concrete edge slab. a group of workers were working in the pump shelter area to replace a drainage pipe when a pump on auto mode started up suddenly, producing a loud pitch sound. the ip who was working near the pump, was shocked and left the work area in a hurry. his left foot got stuck underneath a valve and he tripped and hit his right knee against the concrete edge slab. the ip suffered a cut on his right knee. he was brought to the pier medical centre where he was given some stitches and medication. first aid was conducted to the ip and brought to the pier medical centre for treatment.

category: covid, general illness or health issue
text: a wood worker was embarked  on pce1. the ip performed the covid-19 test with a positive result. a wood worker was embarked  on pce1. the ip performed the covid-19 test with a positive result. the ip is symptomatic the ip is feeling symptoms such as fever and headache. he received guidance from the nursing technician regarding the necessary care and will be sent home for quarantine period.

one wood employee tested positive for covid during premobilization screening.  one wood employee tested positive for covid during premobilization screening. ee has minor symptom and returned home for quarantine. no contact tracing required.  ee instructed to return home for quarantine.
individual tested positive for covid-19 individual was identified through contact tracing and isolated. a test was performed and return back as positive. individual quarantined

linesman lowering insulators, capstan winch brake failed resulting in minor rope burns to hands the incident occurred during the blocking out of a steel lattice tower (hw74) during the blocking out of the lower cross-arm, the insulator string had been secured to an endless rope that was connected to the capstan winch of a hired mule atv. during this operation the polyester marlow rope became entangled in the wheat crop in the field, as the injured person (ip) attempted to clear this the brake on the mule had failed to engage correctly, the insulator string started to fall uncontrollably and the rope started running through the brake and around the winch drum. the ip grabbed the rope to get it under control but due to the momentum from the falling insulator the rope continued to run and the friction of the rope burnt through the hand protection resulting in friction burns to the ip’s hands. control of the falling insulators was regained before they hit the ground and they were then landed within the demarcated danger / drop zone without further incident. the ip then immediately soaked his hands in water to provide a cooling effect from the rope burns he had sustained. the ip assessed his injuries are considered that they were not serious enough to require any first aid or medical intervention. the ip then immediately soaked his hands in water to provide a cooling effect from the rope burns he had sustained. the ip assessed his injuries are considered that they were not serious enough to require any first aid or medical intervention.

a skid steer operator’s bucket made contact with a pile while dumping sand into trench. on wednesday, january 20th, 2021, at approximately 4:15pm, the civil crew was putting sand at the bottom of a trench near pcs-23. during this process, a skid steer operator made contact with an installation pile after being instructed to back up by their spotter. the pile was damaged when the operator turned to the skid steer to the left as they were backing up. the actual severity rating is an a1 due to the damage to the installation pile being less than $10k. the potential severity rating is an a1 due to there being no possibility that the damage would be more than $10k nor were personnel at risk of being injured. operator notified supervisor who called for hsse. scene was frozen, hsse arrived on scene. both individuals were brought to the safety office. investigation protocols were initiated.

ee was traveling on a lease road when he struck a yellow cement barrier with his wood vehicle.  on june 30, 2019 at 7:08 pm, a wood ee was traveling at the atlas ctf near orla, texas when his vehicle came in contact with a yellow cement barrier. the impact caused damage to the passenger door handle, passenger side back door, and the passenger side fender/bumper of the vehicle.  ee contacted account manager to notify him of the incident. he was also taken in for a post drug/alcohol drug screen.

category: vehicle Incident involving animal, vehicle incident general
text: whilst driving to worksite, clipped a kangaroo with bullbar - no damage, no injuries - report only whilst driving a work vehicle at 5.10am (pre-dawn) along the wallan-whittlesea road eden park, a kangaroo jumped across the road in front of the car.the vehicle had driving lights and a bullbar, the driver applied and locked up the brakes to avoid collision.the tail of the kangaroo was clipped by the bullbar and it hopped away. no damage to vehicle or injury to driver.posted speed 100kmh, nearest intersection wildwood road. nil

loss of power to beatrice alpha resulting in a down man of non-essential personnel. migrated from legacy cairs incident #31420loss of power to beatrice alpha resulting in a down man of non-essential personnel the beatrice alpha suffered a power outage due to e-turbine tripping on ‘deviation – high exhaust temperature’.the ap emergency generator was u/s, as a result of water contamination in the diesel system.in the meantime the decision was taken on a precautionary basis to down man part of the crew, based on the risk of continuing the incident into the hours of darkness with reduced services.windcat 15 was mobilised to support the flight operations and provide radar cover over night.the nav aids remained operational on the alpha platform.19 personnel were de-mobilised to aberdeen and were accommodated in the speedbird hotel overnight. 22 pob remained on board continuing to working the issue.the fuel system on the ap emergency generator was drained down and the maintenance team replaced the injectors and bled the fuel system. the emergency generator was re-started at 1700hrs on 27/09/16. there was an electrical issue (circuit breaker would not close). this was identified to a u/s solenoid. the ap emergency generator electrical power was restored at 2015hrs on 27/09/16.on 28/09/16 e turbine diesel day tank was topped up and a fuel sample taken. no water contamination. e turbine fuel system was bled through. e turbine was brought on-line at 1050. the ap emergency generator was shutdown at 1600hrs. migrated from legacy cairs - see detailed description

category: foot or leg injury, slips & trips
text: wood employee tripped on scaffold leg and fell to same level causing a laceration to the left knee. a wood scaffold helper tripped over a scaffold runner (runner is 6" from structural grating) which caused her to fall forward and fall to same level contacting the structural grating.  the employee was directed to gather two right angle clamps and a six foot handrail. the employee walked around tank ev-30 (approximately a 30' walk around the tank) and collected the two scaffold clamps. the employee walked back around tank ev-30 with the scaffold clamps in left hand the employee attempted to step over the scaffold runner but her foot did not clear the runner causing the employee to fall forward and the left knee contact the  grating causing a laceration to the knee. the employee was taken to medical where she was evaluated and released back to work with first aid treatment.  1.work was stopped immediately. 2. the employee was provided with medical attention immediately. 3. emergency was summons immediately by plant operator, per protocol. the employee was transported by dow ems to all american screening and medical for evaluation. 4. a site wide stand-down was scheduled at 3:00pm at the contractor lunch tent.  employee was released from off site clinic with first aid treatment.

employee fell and dislocated his shoulder. the employee was in the process of cleaning spillage from inside the chute of the head end of conveyor 004 when the slipped and fell. his shoulder collided with the floor surface on which he was standing on and became dislocated. 1. area was evacuated2. ip was removed from the chute3. emergency control room notified and ambulance dispatched4. ip was taken to the mine doctor for an examination and treatment5. stand down was conducted with the crew and the incident was discussed

minor hydraulic oil leak  while offloading shoring sheets one of the hydraulic hoses on the hiab burst, leaking a small amount of hydraulic oil onto the hard standing working area.  the burst hose on the hiab was repaired and the contaminated material was removed.

category: dropped object or material, foot or leg injury, lifting or moving loads
text: struck by falling object or equipment, n.e.c. employee was crushed by falling sheetrock while it was being moved at a renovation site located at 205 boulevard, roland, oklahoma. the sheetrock was leaned in an upright position, totaling 17 sheets or 1,360 pounds. the material fell on the employee's legs and crushed them.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation a support for erecting a solar array was being driven into the ground, but had stopped due to an underground obstruction. an employee was re-connecting a chain to the ground support when the puller ram machine activated, causing the chain to rise up and tighten around the support and catch the employee's finger. the employee sustained an open fracture, laceration, and hematoma to the index finger.
nonclassifiable an employee received an amputation.
exposure to environmental heat on 7/29/15, an employee was walking to the assembly area when she fainted. she was hospitalized and treated for severe dehydration.
shooting by other person-intentional an employee was exiting an armored truck to make a delivery when an attempted robbery occurred. he was shot in the arm and required hospitalization.

category: lifting or moving loads, vehicle incident general, dropped object or material, foot or leg injury, slips & trips
text: struck by object falling from vehicle or machinery-other than vehicle part an employee was changing a forklift battery that was suspended from a hoist.  while the employee was moving the hoist, the battery slipped off the hoist hook and fell on the employee's right foot.  three toes on the employee's right foot were amputated.

category: foot or leg injury, lifting or moving loads
text: struck against stationary object or equipment, n.e.c. employee was working from the derrick monkey board latching and unlatching tubing. as he was unlatching the elevator that has horns and a locking mechanism, the employee's harness got caught on the horns. the horns pulled the harness and pulled him down causing small fractures in his knees that required surgery.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was working on a press machine when he got caught in two nip points, degloving his right hand. the guard on the folder section was bypassed at the time of the incident.
struck by object or equipment, unspecified an employee was struck by a wood wall while dismantling a movie set.
exposure to environmental heat an employee collapsed due to heat exposure while delivering mail, requiring overnight hospitalization.
fall or jump from vehicle in normal operation, nonroadway an employee was injured while conducting snow surveys. he was ejected from a snowmobile and sustained a back and neck injury.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation at about 4:10 p.m. on november 7, 2018, an employee was operating a foot-pedal-activated riveting machine. the employee's left thumb accessed the point-of-operation during a riveting cycle, and a rivet (along with the employee's glove) was embedded in the  thumb.

category: hand or arm injury, slips & trips
text: fall on same level due to tripping, unspecified on december 13, 2019, an employee tripped and fell in a corridor. the employee suffered a broken right forearm and underwent surgery.

category: dropped object or material, foot or leg injury, lifting or moving loads
text: struck by falling object or equipment, n.e.c. a steel beam fell onto an employee's left foot, crushing four toes.

category: hand or arm injury, slips & trips
text: slip without fall, n.e.c.  an employee was setting culverts along a highway. after a culvert was in place, the employee slipped on the embankment. the employee grabbed the rim of the culvert to catch his fall and lacerated three fingers on the left hand.

category: foot or leg injury, fall from or working at height issue, slips & trips
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified an employee was descending a jobsite-made ladder when he slipped and fell, breaking his right ankle.

jack-knifed or overturned, nonroadway an employee was operating a construction roller machine when it tipped over. the employee fell off the equipment and received internal injuries, requiring hospitalization.

category: lifting or moving loads, hand or arm injury
text: struck against stationary object or equipment, n.e.c. an employee was climbing down a ladder when it shifted to one side. the employee's hand came into contact with wires, which cut his right middle, ring, and little fingers.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was injured while performing a routine wheel inspection diagnostics checklist. during this inspection and as the wheel assembly was spinning, the employee's right hand entered into the wheel assembly and his index finger extended beyond the spoke of the wheel as it passed the brake caliper assembly. a pinch point occurred between the caliper and the spoke and amputated the fingertip.
nonclassifiable an employee was cleaning the quill puller (defeathering machine) with water and amputated the right pinky finger. the machine was not locked out at the time.

category: dropped object or material, hand or arm injury, slips & trips
text: struck by falling object or equipment, unspecified an employee's fingertip was amputated when a drill rig bucket fell on his finger.

other fall to lower level less than 6 feet an employee was working from a 4-foot platform ladder, pulling wire, when the wire came loose and he lost his balance. he then stepped 4 feet off the ladder and onto the ground, fracturing his left hip.

category: fall from or working at height issue
text: other fall to lower level 6 to 10 feet an employee was checking bin fill levels on a bin platform. the railing had not sprung back into place and he fell about eight feet from the platform to the receiving floor. he was hospitalized.

category: foot or leg injury, slips & trips
text: water vehicle incident, n.e.c. an employee was entering a submarine when he slipped on the deck and strained his knee, requiring hospitalization.

category: general injury, hand or arm injury, fall from or working at height issue
text: fall through surface or existing opening 6 to 10 feet an employee was cleaning the units on the second floor when he stepped on a loose platform close to the forklift and fell 10 feet to the ground. the employee was hospitalized with a broken right elbow and had surgery.

category: head or face injury, slips & trips
text: fall on same level due to slipping  an employee was walking toward a sink in the bathroom when she slipped on water and fell, hitting her head on the floor. she was hospitalized with a concussion.

caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee was clearing scrap from the press outfeed roller conveyor and contacted the chain and sprocket resulting in a partial amputation of the right middle finger.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee was performing forklift/rigging operations (material handling) with a telescopic handler (telescoping forklift). while adjusting the forks on the handler, the employee's right index finger was caught in a pinch point between the adjustment box and the forks, lacerating and fracturing it. the finger was amputated down to the first knuckle.
compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee was operating a hoist and lowered a roll of carpet onto the left index finger resulting in a fingertip amputation.

category: lifting or moving loads, general injury
text: overexertion in lifting-single episode an employee was lifting the trailer hitch of an air compressor and sustained torn muscles in his legs, hips, and buttocks.

nonroadway noncollision incident, n.e.c. an employee had climbed down from a roof and was still wearing his fall protection harness and lanyard. he proceeded to operate a forklift and ran over his lanyard, pulling him out of the forklift.  he was hospitalized with three broken ribs and other possible injuries.

category: general injury, fall from or working at height issue
text: fall through surface or existing opening 6 to 10 feet an employee fell eight feet from or through a floor that was being structurally removed resulting in back and rib injuries.

category: foot or leg injury, slips & trips
text: fall on same level, n.e.c.  an employee was walking when he lost his footing and fell back while his foot was in place, causing his left leg to break.

category: general injury, fall from or working at height issue
text: other fall to lower level 11 to 15 feet  an employee fell off the fire escape approximately 15 feet to the concrete ground below. the employee was knocked unconscious and sustained seven broken ribs on the right side, a punctured right lung and a fractured scapula.

category: fall from or working at height issue, head or face injury
text: other fall to lower level 6 to 10 feet an employee was walking on an elevated edge, using a broom to clean cobwebs and dust. the employee fell about 9 feet to a concrete floor, suffering a head injury. the employee was hospitalized.

category: hand or arm injury, head or face injury
text: struck against moving part of machinery or equipment an employee was using an air nozzle to clean a dual-head table router. the router's blade hit the employee's right thumb, lacerating it.

category: hand or arm injury, vehicle incident general
text: caught in or compressed by equipment or objects, unspecified an employee was inspecting a vehicle's wheel and tire while the vehicle was on a lift when the employee's hand was caught between the vehicle's brake caliper and wheel spokes. the employee's right middle and ring fingers were amputated.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment employees were using a forklift to move a piece of steel onto a structure when an employee's hand was caught between the steel load and the structure. the employee sustained a crushing injury that resulted in amputation of the right ring fingertip.

category: dropped object or material, foot or leg injury
text: struck by falling object or equipment, unspecified an employee was torch-cutting a coupler off a railcar. the coupler fell onto the employee's left foot, breaking it.

pedestrian struck by forward-moving vehicle in nonroadway area an employee was directing the driver of a truck. the truck's right front tire drove over the employee's lower left leg (below the knee) and onto the right leg near the calf. the truck was then backed off the employee. the employee was hospitalized with swelling, a contusion, and a blood clot.

struck against stationary object or equipment, n.e.c. an employee injured his right eye when he made contact with a metal peg while bending down to adjust merchandise hanging on a peg-board style display rack. he required surgery and hospitalization.

nonroadway collision with other vehicle, unspecified on september 24, 2020, an employee was injured when the tugger he was operating was struck by a second tugger. the employee was hospitalized for rib fractures.
stepped on object  an employee was removing a loose board from the floor of a trailer when he lost his grip and stepped on a nail sticking out of the floor, puncturing his left foot.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation the employee was rigging a towing strap to a front-end loader to tow a truck out of the mud and onto matting. the front-end loader moved while the employee's thumb was between the vertical drop pin and the tow bar of the front-end loader, resulting in a partial thumb tip amputation.

struck by dislodged flying object, particle an employee was pulling a rear sway bar off of a vehicle when a piece of metal came loose and hit him in the eye. he sustained a tear to the iris and cornea of the right eye, requiring hospitalization and surgery.

category: hand or arm injury, knife incident
text: injured by slipping or swinging object held by injured worker a chef was slicing limes with a knife and amputated their left ring fingertip.

injured by slipping or swinging object held by injured worker an employee was baling material and using a retractable box cutter to cut a box down to bale it when the blade went through the cardboard and lacerated his left wrist requiring hospitalization.

category: lifting or moving loads, back injury, general injury
text: struck or run over by rolling powered vehicle an excavator was dislodged from a flatbed trailer after hitting an overpass on northbound i-15. an employee attempted to reload the excavator onto the trailer.  the excavator encountered fluid on the flatbed and slipped off the trailer. the employee was injured, sustaining a hairline fracture to the neck vertebrae.

category: head or face injury, vehicle incident general
text: nonroadway collision with object other than vehicle, n.e.c. an employee was installing fiber optic cable from a scissor lift. a forklift backed into the scissor lift, causing the employee to fall to the floor about 20 feet below and land head/face first. the employee suffered severe head trauma and broken bones.

category: foot or leg injury, fall from or working at height issue
text: other fall to lower level 6 to 10 feet the employee fell approximately eight feet from a pallet/crate elevated with a forklift, while installing plywood on the windows of the warehouse in preparation for hurricane matthew.  the employee's ankle was fractured.
caught in running equipment or machinery, unspecified an employee's right index fingertip was caught in the pinch point of moving equipment, amputating the fingertip.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation on or about september 29, 2016, an employee was operating a brush chipper. the employee began to dismount the chipper by grabbing the winch rope. at the same time, the winch rope control switch was activated, causing the rope to tighten around the employee's left index finger, crushing and partially amputating it.

category: foot or leg injury, hand or arm injury
text: caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee was bagging frozen leg quarters with a machine and was attempting to remove a jammed staple when the machine activated and the employee's thumb pad was partially amputated.
struck, caught, or crushed in other collapsing structure or equipment an employee was cutting and removing the wires from a paper bale when part of the bale fell apart, causing a fracture to his leg.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee was tightening the belt to a screen drive motor assembly when the employee's right thumb became caught between the belt and pulley, amputating the thumb tip.

other fall to lower level less than 6 feet an employee entered a bus and tried to activate the service door lever, but fell down the three stairs inside the bus and onto the asphalt outside. the employee suffered a broken hip.

category: foot or leg injury, hand or arm injury
text: caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was positioning the end of a coil into the butt welder machine. as the employee pressed the foot pedal to close the pneumatic clamp his right index finger was caught in the clamp and amputated at the first knuckle.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was emptying a bag of collected dust from a dust collection system. the bag and the employee's hand were pulled into the airlock hopper valve. the employee's hand was lacerated.

category: foot or leg injury, general injury, slips & trips
text: fall on same level, unspecified an employee fell while walking to the restroom, suffering lower leg/knee pain and a hip fracture.
fall on same level due to tripping over an object  an employee was moving a patient's walker out of a hospital aisle. the employee tripped over the walker, fell, and was injured.

category: foot or leg injury, fall from or working at height issue
text: other fall to lower level, unspecified an employee missed a step and fell while walking down the stairs, injuring the left knee and suffering a ruptured patella tendon. both of the employee's hands were occupied at the time of the incident.

part of occupantís body caught between vehicle and other object in nonroadway transport incident an employee was material handling freight with a jack. when she advanced the jack, she was pinned between an upright beam and the jack. she suffered deep bruising in the liver area.
other fall to lower level less than 6 feet an employee fell from the second rung of a fixed ladder on a feed bin. the employee landed on the ground and suffered a back injury.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was trying to remove a chip tray from the bottom of a drilling machine. the machine injured the top of the employee's right hand and the tips of four fingers.

struck by discharged object or substance on june 3, 2017, an employee was kneeling and using a pneumatic staple gun to secure corners of a prop frame. the employee fired a staple into the wood and it kicked back, causing a second staple to eject from the gun and impale her knee. she was hospitalized and had surgery.

compressed or pinched by shifting objects or equipment an employee was connecting a trailer to a pickup truck and pinched their left index finger between the trailer and the ball on the trailer hitch resulting in a fingertip amputation.
injury by other person-unintentional or intent unknown, n.e.c. an employee fell to the ground and dislocated a hip after accidental contact with another coworker.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation while grinding a piece of metal an employee's left thumb got caught between the piece of metal and the grinding wheel resulting in partial amputation of the left thumb.

caught in running equipment or machinery during regular operation an employee was loading card stock into a corner-cutting machine. the blade in the machine amputated the employee's left middle fingertip.
overexertion involving outside sources, unspecified three employees were moving a patient. the patient fell and one of the employees sustained a back injury requiring hospitalization.

category: general injury, hand or arm injury
text: caught in running equipment or machinery during maintenance, cleaning  an employee was cleaning a rib cage when his arm became stuck in two rollers that are designed to crush chicken bones. his left arm broke in multiple places and had to be surgically amputated above the elbow. the crusher was not locked out at the time of the incident.
